resources.string: ARK Invest, an investment management company focused solely on disruptive innovation, has done a lot of research on the foundational innovations that will shape our world in the next few decades.

ARK Invest, an investment management company focused solely on disruptive innovation, has done a lot of research on the foundational innovations that will shape our world in the next few decades. They refer to these foundational and disruptive innovations as innovation platforms. While information technology and the ARK has identified five innovation platforms that they driving costs down, creating huge demand growth across virtually all sectors and geographies.
A program under ASIST - Augmented Social Innovations through Science and Technology

Empower and encourage the engineering minds to work for the social cause through: 
- Organising Competitions for young engineering graduates, engineering students and school students in the themes aligned with the vision. 
- Recognising the engineering educators for their service to the society 
- Creating a strong network for mentors and mentees from industry and academia. 
- Encouraging Interdisciplinary work in creating solutions for social issues.
To instill social responsibility and ethics as a continuing education in the young minds through activities and encourage service oriented engineering practice.

Innovation Challenge is an international project competition established by IEEE Madras Section and IEEE Education Society to encourage the participants to come up with innovative ideas for the social and humanitarian issues. Here YESIST12 acts as a platform to bridge the gap between the engineers and visonaries to contribute to the society with innovations.\nThis exceptional platform conducts competition in two stages. The preliminary stage is conducted across Asian and African countries and the team that tops the round wins a chance to compete globally to address humanitarian and social issues like poverty, famine, special needs, women safety, healthcare, disaster management, and many more.

1. Novelty
2. Clarity
3. Feasibility and Practicability
4. User Experience
5. Scale of impact
6. Sustainability
7. Potential for future work progression.

MakerFair is a unique platform with opportunities for the innovators, makers, and creators to showcase their marvelous products to the international community. Teams with enthusiasm and determination of inventing and showcasing their innovative ideas which are capable from ideation to commercialization are invited to register for this event.\n In 2021, MakerFair Track have goals to achieve maximum goals which can be helpful to the world regarding the problems World has been facing in recent times under the UN Sustainable Development Goals.

1. Problem Definition and User Definition
2. Solution and Implementation
3. Innovation
4. Potential for social impact and commercialization purposes
5. Presentation and Project to Product level

-Team size: Maximum of 4 members. 
-Team members may come from different academic institutions/industries and from different countries. Only the registered members of the team will be given certificates. Mentor names should also accompany the team registration. 
-Teams shall display their working projects in the venue, explain and demonstrate to the audience and evaluators. 
-The evaluation will be based on the following criteria: Challenge, Innovation, Usability, and Extendibility. 
-Teams are locked along with abstract submission, and no further changes to team membership and mentors can be made after that. 
-Each team is solely responsible for its own cooperation and teamwork.

Junior Einstein Track acts as a catalyst for innovation and provides a transformative opportunity to broaden the horizon of knowledge among the young curious minds. This event makes effort to harness the creative submissions and innovative spirit towards Scientific and technological ideas/innovations from the school students of age 12 to 17 and to get rooted as one of the foremost project competition in the global arena developing a robust scientific temper among the youth.\n

-Team size: Maximum of 4 members. 
-Participant’s Age: 12 to 17 years. Proof for the same shall be submitted. (Bonafide letter from school or birth certificate) 
-Team members may come from different academic institutions/industries and from different countries. Only the registered members of the team will be given certificates. Mentor names should also accompany the team registration. 
-Teams are locked along with abstract submission and no further changes to team members and mentors can be made thereafter. 
-Teams shall present their working projects in the virtually, explain and demonstrate to the audience and evaluators. 
-The evaluation will be based on the following criteria: Novelty / Innovation, Participant’s knowledge on concept / market demand, Technical implementation, Expandability of the project idea/prototype to an actual product or solution, Clarity of pitch. 
-Plagiarism at any forms or at any stage is strictly prohibited. 
-Each team is solely responsible for its own cooperation and teamwork. 

The projects can be a software solution or hardware integrated.

1. Novelty
2. Clarity
3. Feasibility and Practicability
4. User Experience
5. Scale of impact
6. Sustainability
7. Potential for future work progression.

The World Bank recently started “South Asia Gender and Energy” (SAGE) initiative with a plan to establish a “Women in Power Sector Network in South Asia (WePOWER)” to promote women engineers and practitioners in the energy and power sector, and bring normative change regarding women in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) education. 
 The example of the value propositions are:
 -Capacity building
 -Networking and mentorship for women engineers for career advancement
 -Exposure to technology and utility/energy sector in developed countries
 -Access to information and conferences
 -Recruitment opportunities
 -Exposure and encouragement to women students to pursue energy sector engineering jobs as a viable career option 
WePOWER topics:
 -Renewable Energy
 -Energy Conservation and Management
 -Energy Auditing
 -Power Generation, Transmission and Distribution
 -Flexible AC Transmissions System (FACTS)
 -IoT in Energy and Smart Grid
 -Digitalization(AI, ML, Computing) in Renewable Energy
 -Smart Technologies in Electrical Power Sector Network

1. Problem Definition and User Definition
2. Solution and Implementation
3. Innovation
4. Potential for social impact and commercialization purposes
5. Presentation and Project to Product level

-Team size: Maximum of 4 members (at least one girl). 
-Team members may come from different academic institutions/industries and from different countries. 
-Teams are locked along with abstract submission, and no further changes to team membership and mentors can be made after that. 
-Working model (hardware), simulation works, research studies and idea proposition are all accepted during the finals. However the technical content should be strong and sufficient literature review has to be done (and everything should be mentioned in the abstract also). Proposed area should be innovative and should have positive potential impact. 
-Each Team is solely responsible for its own cooperation and teamwork.

Special Track aims at bringing out the innovative solutions to solve issues of mankind, on a global scale. It is the recently added track in YESIST12 during its 2020 edition and focussed on health and disaster management. In 2021, Special Track targets on providing solutions to more challenges faced by every individual on the planet. Novel ideas, creative proposals with interesting presentations are rewarded and appreciated
 The submissions could be related to the following topics:
 -Clean water and Sanitation.
 -Improvised medical and health care
 -Sustainable cities and communities.
 -Preventive measures from hazards and disasters.
 -Environmental Engineering

-The team size is from 2 to 4 members. 
-A team may comprise members from varied academic institutions/ Industries and maybe from different countries. 
-People who enroll themselves along with team member's registration along with the mentor details will be provided with certificates. 
-The selected teams will be given a chance to present their projects through an online platform to the judging panel. 
-Once the team finalization is done along with their abstract, there will be no more changes with their membership and the mentor details. 
-Coordination and teamwork must be taken care of by the team leader. Further details regarding the platform and logistics will be updated to you all soon.

1. Problem Definition and User Definition
2. Solution and Implementation
3. Innovation
4. Potential for social impact and commercialization purposes
5. Presentation and Project to Product level
Gear up to listen to the ocean of knowledge. The speakers will nourish with their experiences.
Get in touch with professionals from all walks of life and build good relationships.
This is the best place to showcase your innovations and get the right results out of it to move ahead.
You get to participate in the phenomenal event with experienced people nailing it the best.
You get a good reach for your innovations and everyone will get valuable certificates.
Being part of a YESIST12 you get to connect with like minded people, geographically to collaborate and grow.

Nikitha is an electronics engineer who is currently working as a Business Technology Analyst at Deloitte US-India. A Philomath with a strong inclination to all things \'Tech\', she believes that the ocean of knowledge is never ceasing to be explored, promising those who take up the journey immense treasures and opportunities to grow and upgrade themselves. She is immensely passionate about volunteering and strongly advocates for gender equity among STEM domains. \nShe finds great inspiration in people and credits IEEE for blessing her with opportunities that honed her team management and organizing skills. Under IEEE, she is a Young Professional and an Exe-Com member for TEMS Society Hyderabad section chapter. She was also a former content volunteer at IEEE WIE ILS 2020 and IEEE Data Science Bootcamp 1.0 under IEEE SSIT Madras Section Chapter, a PES Zero Hunger Day ambassador, an IEEE madC and IEEE Day ambassador as well as a student volunteer for AHCSSC 2019 and 2020. Apart from IEEE, she has been an active volunteer for other non-profit organizations like We For You and Youth For Seva. When away from work, she loves to read books, enhance her culinary skills or experiment with various craft and lettering styles.

Dev is an Electrical and Electronic Engineer who works at Brantel Lanka (PVT) Limited, Sri Lanka. He has completed Bachelor’s degree in Electrical and Electronic Engineering at University of Jaffna, Sri Lanka and currently he is following his Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering in University of Moratuwa, Sri Lanka.
 Dev is an IEEE VoLT (Volunteer Leadership Training) graduate in 2020 who is holding IEEE technical society memberships in IEEE PES, IEEE IAS and IEEE PELS. His volunteering extremities were lying when leading as the Committee Member of IEEE YESIST 12 Maker Fair consecutively in 2019 and 2020. He is the founder and former chair of IEEE PES Student Branch Chapter, University of Jaffna, Sri Lanka. 
His vast experiences were remarked with volunteering in “International Conference on Information and Automation for Sustainability 2018, Sri Lanka”, “IEEE R10 Humanitarian Technology Conference 2018, Sri Lanka” and again in 2019, Indonesia. 
Moreover, Dev has volunteered as the Country Representative (Sri Lanka) of IEEE PES Day 2020 as well as in 2021. He showed off his talent and excellency in leading the IEEE Day 2020 as the Regional Lead of Region 10 (SL, BD, IN, PK). This guy is giving his best as the Lead Ambassador in IEEE Collabratec and IEEE Brand Ambassador for past years while grabbing the international recognition. At the moment Dev is the Country Representative of IEEE PES CSAC (Chapters Student Activity Committee) 2021. As well as he works as the Editor in IEEE PELS Sri Lanka Chapter, Committee Member in IEEE PES Sri Lanka Chapter and Vice Chairman of IEEE IAS Sri Lanka chapter. He is truly a remarkable individual of dedication and excellency on the platform of IEEE

Ramneek is a Computer Science Engineer and Proactive Volunteer at numerous organizations namely IEEE, Youth for Sustainability, Atal Innovation Mission (NITI Aayog, Govt. of India), Human Circle (Young India Challenge). He is an IEEE Young Professional who is working currently in Amazon Inc. \nHe is holding responsibilities of IEEE Impact Creator, Program Co-Lead of IEEE Computer Society Student Leadership Program under IEEE Computer Society SYP Committee, Co-Chair of WePOWER Track at IEEE YESIST12-2021, Author at IEEE USA E-Books, Member of “Universal Access to Technology” Technical Committee of IEEE SSIT, Member of IEEE SA Industry Connect Program on “Intelligent Transportation System Testbed Development for Dynamic Road Traffic Management and Control at Electronics-City, Bangalore, India” and IEEE Brand Ambassador. \nHe had volunteered and contributed as Mentor to 4 Teams in IEEE Xtreme Programming Contest 14.0, Chair of Technical Committee at IEEE WIE ILS 2020, Co-Chair of IEEE Data Science Bootcamp 1.0 under IEEE SSIT Madras Section Chapter, Project Development Committee Member at IEEE Smart Village US, Advisor of Innovation Challenge Track at IEEE YESIST12-2020, Web Developer at TEDx AIACTR Delhi India and Chairperson and Webmaster of IEEE HMR Institute of Technology and Management New Delhi India. With the curiosity to learn new things, he had deep-dived into research world as well, his research interests include Edge Computing and emerging Technologies. He had published around 15+ Research papers in IEEE Sponsored Conferences, Elsevier/Springer Journals and he holds 1 patent which was the motivation from his 3rd Year Research Project. With holding hands on volunteering and leadership positions, he had been awarded with numerous titles including Best Support Person by his previous employer, Dr. JK Pal Award by IEEE Delhi Section, Technocrat by his Graduation Institute in his 1st Year of Study and numerous technical exhibitions and conferences awards during his course of graduation.

Ms. Indhumathi Gunasekaran is an Associate Software Engineer at Accenture, India. She holds her bachelors in Electronics and Communication Engineering from Panimalar Institute of Technology, Chennai, India. She is currently serving in the roles of Regional Student ambassador of R10, Co-chair of IEEE YESIST12 (Special Track), Member of PELS Students Sub-committee, Member of PELS Women in Engineering, Founding Chair of Nuclear and Plasma Sciences society and IEEE Brand Ambassador. She served as the Section lead of IEEEXtreme 14.0,Publicity and Promotions Lead of IEEE WIE International Leadership Summit 2020, Student Chapter Ambassador of Power and Energy Society, Chairperson of Computer Society chapter of IEEE Panimalar Institute of Technology Student Branch and Vice-Chairperson of IEEE PIT SB. Indhumathi was previously the IEEE Student Branch Secretary and Chairperson of Women in Engineering AG of the Student Branch. 
Indhu has won IEEE Women in Engineering Inspiring Student Member Award (2020) for her distinguished leadership and outstanding contributions as a volunteer, at the Section and Regional levels, serving the IEEE and IEEE Women in Engineering for the benefit of its members and the engineering profession; IEEE CS Richard E Merwin Scholarship for her outstanding leadership as a Student Volunteer; IEEE CS Upsilon Pi Epsilon Scholarship and Grace Hopper Celebration India Scholarship in recognition of her outstanding academic and professional accomplishments. 
Acknowledging her achievements she has been awarded as the ""Outstanding Student Award 2020"" , ""EMERGING STUDENT VOLUNTEER” award for the year 2018 and ""The Best Student of the Year 2018"" by ISTE TN Section level in their 18th Annual Convention. Not just in IEEE but she has also proved herself in academics with outstanding performance. She secured the first rank in her department during the university examinations for several academic years. She has been an active participant, volunteer and has coordinated and organized many co-curricular and extracurricular activities. She has been and will always be a source of inspiration for upcoming minds. 
She has a been a kind person in helping new minds for their development. In her spare time, she founded and served as organizing secretary for She-the coder and initiated several school education program. Her determination and courage has made her to do many achievements making her as remarkable person.

Dr. Aishwarya Bandla heads the Translational Core at The N.1 Institute for Health and is a Senior Research Fellow at the National University of Singapore (NUS). A multidisciplinary team of scientists and clinicians, her research group focuses on wearable bioengineering solutions for disease prevention in the oncology and neurology spectrum. Dr. Bandla holds a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering from NUS, has published her research in high impact peer-reviewed journals and has won several international research conference presentation awards. She represented NUS in the Global Young Scientist’s Summit 2018, a multi-disciplinary platform for conversations on science and research, technology innovation and society, and solutions to global challenges. Aishwarya was also recently featured in the inaugural Singapore’s 100 Women in Tech list 2020, which celebrates women who have made significant contributions to tech in Singapore and for their ability to influence, inspire and impact on community and industry. She was also featured in GovInsider’s Global 50 women in Govtech story. \nAishwarya, an IEEE senior member, chairs the Professional Activities Committee as part of the IEEE Singapore Section and is the immediate past chair of Women in Engineering Singapore. She is also part of the executive committee of the IEEE Region 10 Women in Engineering and the Engineering in Medicine and Biology chapter Singapore. As a circle leader in the Lean In Singapore community, Aishwarya is passionate about motivating professionals to “pay it forward” by mentoring peers and young people.

Janani Ramachandran is a Fellow at Teach For India. She has been an active volunteer for the past 4 years and has volunteered in several events across regions. She has held various leadership roles in IEEE, IEEE CS, IEEE Photonics Society. For her exemplary contributions in academics and volunteering, she was awarded Shri Prahalad P Chabbria "Best Outgoing Student Award" for the year 2020. Due to her extraordinary volunteering contributions, she was awarded the Richard E Merwin Scholarship 2019 by IEEE Computer Society and she is the recipient of the prestigious Grace Hopper Celebration India Scholarship for the year 2019. Her innovative project has bagged the Student Project Funding 2020 by IEEE Madras Section.

Bharathi Ramesh is a third-year undergraduate student from Jeppiaar Engineering College. She has volunteered as a content writer in WIE ILS 2020 and many other events. She has taken responsibilities as Vice-chairperson of the PES society and is currently volunteering as the Chairperson of the WIE affinity group in her college . Other than IEEE she has been volunteering in NSS, Rotaract and Tamil Mandram of her college.

Darwin Jose Raju is an IEEE Senior Member, Associate Professor and the Head of the Department of Electrical and Electronics Engineering in St. Xavier’s Catholic College of Engineering, Tamil Nadu, India. He is an active volunteer of IEEE Madras Section. In addition to being the SIGHT Operations Committee Chair, he is also Chair of IEEE Education Society-Madras Section and Coordinator of IEEE StB 62851- St. Xavier’s Catholic College of Engineering. 
Dr. Raju received his Bachelors in Electrical and Electronics Engineering and Masters in Applied Electronics from the Hindustan College of Engineering, Chennai. He completed an MBA from Tamil Nadu Open University and a PhD in Electrical Engineering from Anna University, Chennai. Now, with more than 20 years of teaching experience, he continues teaching undergraduate and post-graduate classes in various subjects. He has knowledge about Electrical design in MEP services. Under his guidance, many of his students became IEEE members and have been awarded numerous scholarships and awards from IEEE Societies and IEEE WIE. 
For his service as an IEEE volunteer, Dr. Raju was elevated to a Senior Member of IEEE and awarded the “Outstanding Student Branch Counselor” award in 2009. He received the IEEE MGA Leadership Award in 2012, as one of the three global recipients. 
An enthusiastic volunteer with remarkable contributions and achievements, Dr. Raju works for the goodness of society and the student community and believes that success is the joy of self-satisfaction.
